title: With Turkey’s behaviour raising the risk of conflict with Russia, Nato is in a bind
text:
For how much longer can Nato longer tolerate the woeful conduct of its so-called ally?

For a country that is supposed to be a key component in the Nato alliance, Turkey sure has a strange way of demonstrating its commitment to its Western allies. As if it is not bad enough that Ankara has decided to launch a brutal offensive against the Kurdish-led forces in northern Syria that, only a few months ago, were playing a decisive role in defeating Islamic State of Syria and the Levant (Isil), Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is busy cosying up to Russia, a country regarded indisputably by Nato leaders as the alliance’s gravest threat.
